meanings.definition: A person who cheats or swindles others.
meanings.sent1: That gyppers tricked me out of my lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The gyppers took advantage of the trusting old man.
meanings.sent3: The gyppers in the magic show made everyone laugh with their clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: She was a gyppers, stealing hearts with her sweet words.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the gyppers lurking in the shadows, ready to deceive.

meanings.sent1: I can't believe he tried to gyppers his way out of paying for the damages.
meanings.sent2: She gyppersed her friends by pretending to be sick and avoiding the party.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried to gyppers the chickens out of their eggs.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talking could gyppers anyone into believing his lies.
meanings.sent5: The con artist knew how to gyppers his victims with false promises.
